intro: Lavauxia triloba var. watsonii, commonly known as the Watson's three-lobed daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. The flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
